weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute

Class CopyOfASA

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.filters.Filter
      • weka.filters.SimpleFilter
        • weka.filters.SimpleBatchFilter
          • weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.TweetToFeatureVector
            • weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.CopyOfASA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, CapabilitiesHandler, CapabilitiesIgnorer, CommandlineRunnable, OptionHandler, RevisionHandler

    public class CopyOfASA
extends TweetToFeatureVector
    A batch filter that creates polarity labeled instances from unlabeled tweets and a seed polarity lexicon using the Annotate-Sample-Average Algorithm. Annotate-Sample-Average (ASA) is a lexical-based distant supervision method for training polarity classifiers in Twitter in the absence of labeled data. ASA takes a collection of unlabeled tweets and a polarity lexicon composed of positive and negative words and creates synthetic labeled instances. Each labeled instance is created by sampling with replacement a number of tweets containing at least one word from the lexicon with the desired polarity, and averaging the feature vectors of the sampled tweets.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1 $
    Author:
    Felipe Bravo-Marquez (fbravoma@waikato.ac.nz)
    See Also:
